description:
《英乐天天唱》是一档模仿唱歌类节目，目的在于提升大家的英语口语能力。主持人会在每期节目中选取好听的歌曲片段，并给出发音提示和模仿示例。喜欢听音乐的童鞋可要积极参与哦

乐队介绍：

可儿家族合唱团（The Corrs），由来自于爱尔兰小镇一个天主教家庭的四位兄弟姐妹吉姆（Jim）、莎朗（Sharon）、卡罗琳（Caroline）、安德烈（Andrea）组成。可儿家族合唱团是一只独具爱尔兰凯尔特民族风格的乐团。他们父母亲是巡回演出乐团的乐师，在父母亲的指引下，大哥吉姆负责吉他及键盘、大姐莎朗负责演奏小提琴、二姐卡罗琳负责打鼓、小妹安德烈则是吹奏锡笛及身兼主唱。

模唱歌词：

I haven't slept at all in days
It's been so long since we've talked
And I have been here many times
I just don't know what I'm doing wrong

What can I do to make you love me
What can I do to make you care
What can I say to make you feel this
What can I do to get you there

title: 英文歌曲天天唱:  What Can I Do

description:
《英文天天写》是沪江部落一档写作类节目，其目的在于提升大家的英语写作能力。每期节目主持人都会给出一个话题，积极参加的童鞋还会得到主持人的专业点评哦！想提高英语写作的童鞋千万不要错过哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

背景介绍：

Seasons come and seasons go. Before you know it, it is the end of summer.

话题：

1) What is your favorite season and why?

2) Do you enjoy the changing of the seasons, or would you prefer to stay in your favorite season all year long?

范例1：

It is difficult to choose between spring and fall. Since summer and winter are two extremes, I prefer somewhere in the middle. Spring represents a new beginning while fall represents the reaping of benefits. Crops sown during spring can be harvested in the fall. At the same time, fall is also the time when a new school terms starts, while spring is a time for graduation. In a sense, these two seasons mark both a beginning and an end. I enjoy the changing of the seasons, though I would prefer only slight changes without the extreme temperature fluctuation.

title: 英文天天写：Seasons

description:
Now let's start with football where the world governing body FIFA has said that host city Curitiba faces being excluded from the Brazil World Cup, if work to complete the stadium is not speeded up. The FIFA Secretary General Jérôme Valcke says that the work of the stadium is well behind schedule and a decision on whether Curitiba will remain as a host city will be announced on the 18th of February. More from the BBC's Ben Smith.

We've obviously heard about these accidents at stadiums and the delays, but this is arguably the most significant threat to a venue in the World Cup for Jérôme Valcke, the FIFA's general secretary. He said to actually come out and deliver a deadline which is in less than a month now is extremely significant. FIFA are very worried about this stadium and it has huge implications for the World Cup. Curitiba hosts four group matches, including the champion Spain against Australia. And obviously, the implications that it would have for businesses and the fans who've bought tickets and booked hotels is massive. Now, at the moment they throw more money and more workers and there is the hope that come February 18th, which is the deadline that's been set, Curitiba will be in a position to say we are ready.

title: 巴西或将失去承办世界杯资格（有声）

description:
Deutsche Bank is Germany's biggest bank and it's involved in some pretty big scandals too. So much so that litigation and legal settlements costs plunged Deutsche Bank into the red in the last three months of last year. They posted a pre-tax loss of just over €1 billion for the period.

News of the loss came on the same day that representatives from Germany's financial watchdog said they would visit the London offices of Deutsche Bank in connection with their investigation into manipulation of the currency markets. And only last week Deutsche Bank said it would withdraw from gold and silver benchmark price setting as European regulators investigate suspected manipulation of precious metals by banks.

Liam Vaughan is a reporter with Bloomberg Business News here in London. I asked him just how deep are Deutsche Bank's troubles. It's one of the banks that's been, to be fair, among several, well, one of the banks that's been kind of dragged into the LIBOR scandal. So it's you know.

The interbank lending rate.
Yes, absolutely right, which kind of has dogged the entire industry but relates to kind of the manipulation of prices, you know, to benefit traders at the bank. They've taken some hit for that but that's not over. Last week, you know, very kind of disturbingly for Deutsche Bank, they were kind of dragged into investigations into potential rigging of currency rates. Several traders have been suspended at the bank. They've taken losses related to the kind of mis-selling of mortgage-backed securities. They've been implicated in doing kind of dubious derivatives deals with Italian banks again.

Phil:Your words,not mine.Look,uh,your mom and I are a team,and she....we feel like this is a chance for you to show some responsibility.Don’t make us look like jerks here.

Phil:Okay.One more rule.
Luke:What?

title: 聚焦州选，话题众多(1/2)

description:
《英闻天天译》是一档沪江部落的原创翻译互动节目（戳去参与节目>>>），主持人提供翻译参考文本，对大家递交的翻译作品进行点评，和大家共同进步！本期节目选取的是关于工作多了，但工资还那样的一则英文报道，让我们一起在翻译中关注。

SUMMARY：

美国市场齐齐调查，发现工作数目与日俱增，工资却没有增加。这样的后果就是，美国无业游民人数增加，因为大家都不害怕找不到工作，此外，工资却不增加，也让很多员工失去了干劲。

CONTENT：
Government data released Friday show that the economy added 209,000 jobs in July — the sixth straight month that hiring has surpassed the psychological benchmark of 200,000. The unemployment rate inched up to 6.2 percent as the number of people either working or looking for work expanded, possibly a sign that Americans may be feeling more confident about their prospects of finding a job.
Consensus is building among economists that those improvements are sustainable, and many expect that the next phase of recovery will bring higher wages — eventually. But they have not yet materialized. According to Friday's data, average hourly pay was $24.45 inJuly, about 2 percent higher than it was a year ago and on par with the sluggish growth of the past few years. Yet even that gain disappears after adjusting for inflation.
 
KEYWORDS:  
the sixth straight month 连续六个月以来
psychological benchmark 心里基准，理想基准
inched up to 微升至
phase 阶段
not yet materialized 还未实现
on parwith  与···同步，与···保持一致
sluggish growth 增长滞缓
 
REFERENCE：
http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/economy/hiring-picks-up-but-wages-not-keeping-pace/2014/08/01/d1a8bf32-1994-11e4-9349-84d4a85be981_story.html
 
【沪江英语小编】大家在查看主持人提供的翻译版本前，可以先自己进行尝试翻译练习，只有在不断的翻译中翻译能力才能有所提升哦！

轻松注册沪江，马上参与【英闻天天译】节目练翻译→

本期节目参考译文：（参考译文由该节目主持人提供，仅供参考，欢迎大家讨论）

参考译文1：

周五，据政府发布的一组数据显示，七月份经济使得岗位增加了209，000处之多---这已是连续第六个月份岗位增幅超过理想基准数额200，000了。且随着无业者以及不找工作者数目的增加，失业率业已微升至百分之6.2，此或表明美国人可能对找工作前景持自信态度。
经济学家正普遍达成共识，认为此类提升势态稳定，部分专家还预计下一阶段的回复可使薪酬提高。不过该种假设至今仍未实现。根据周五发布的数据显示，七月份每小时薪酬可达24.45美元，较之于上一年度提升了两个百分点，并与近年来滞缓涨幅持平。

title: 津巴布韦的粮食危机(1/2)

description:
还在羡慕BBC播音员员一口地道标准的英式发音吗？想要练就纯正英音，《BBC英音模仿秀》帮你忙！《BBC英音模仿秀》是一档沪江部落的原创口语互动节目，主持人对音频进行重点讲解和示范模仿，并对大家递交的口语模仿作品进行一对一的点评！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

今日主持人：Junekaname

22秒音频：

主持人模仿音频：

模仿文本：

ISIS uses its wealth to expand its popular base, providing public services and repairing infrastructure in the areas it controls. Its use of social media is highly professional. On its websites, it issues annual reports, containing detail accounts of its acquisitions and operations, including breakdowns of the bombings, assassinations and suicide missions it's carried out.

语调示意图：

 

重点单词发音讲解： 
issue
acquisition
assassination

想要得到主持人专业的点评和意见吗？快来节目现场一试身手吧>>
